channel.title: Hul.to
channel.description: My personal site for blog posts and guides.

item.title: Bsides Rochester 2019 - Goofkit - Getting goofy with kernel functions
item.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oAwHJQvxO6M

Description: Two easy techniques to make your rootkit stealthier and more robust! Goofkit is a new Linux Kernel Module (LKM) rootkit being released. It uses both inline hooking and trampolining to create a more robust, and stealthy rootkit. This talk will cover how traditional LKM rootkits are made, what can be done better, and why. This talk is aimed at those who are interested in building a rootkit, looking to improve their own, or just learn more about how Linux works.

item.title: Trampolining rootkits with Rayne
item.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wVG2IUaDV40

Description: Jack “Hulto” McKenna and Rayne Cafaro provide a detailed explanation of how rootkits work and what they’re capable of. They provide details on how in-line function hooking works as well as trampolining within the kernel.

item.title: Red team fire talk
item.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ey8DoePoZ9k

Description: Micah “knif3” Martin and Jack “Hulto” McKenna go in detail about the various tactics that the RIT redteam uses when volunteering at competitions. This talk is aimed at helping students who plan on blue teaming prepare for their competitions.

item.title: If you can't hack it pack it - AV bypass using crypters and packers
item.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JcV-YegR9iQ

Description: Jack McKenna discusses how packers and crypters work to hide malware from antivirus products

item.title: CVE Easy - Discovering CVE-2018-16546
item.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3LgypRsJ5kI

Description: Walkthrough of how I found CVE-2018-16546 in Amrcest IP camera and how you can find CVEs too.

item.title: Root-kits a comic book adventure
item.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8u_4mWUAZxo

Description: Linux Kernel module rootkits and the difference between inline hooking and overwriting the system call table

item.title: DEFCON r00tz An Overview of CTF Events
item.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JcV-YegR9iQ

Description: Talk and workshop teaching kids 16 and under how to get started in CTFs. Discussed a range of problems from ceasar ciphers to buffer overflows.
